Algernon Moncrieff.name: Algernon Moncrieff
Algernon Moncrieff.role: A young bachelor living in a flat in Half-Moon Street, known for his wit and playful demeanor

Lane.name: Lane
Lane.role: Algernon's manservant, responsible for household tasks and serving tea

Lady Bracknell.name: Lady Bracknell
Lady Bracknell.role: Algernon's aunt and Gwendolen's mother, a formidable and opinionated aristocrat

Lord Shoreman.name: Lord Shoreman
Lord Shoreman.role: A guest who dined with Algernon on Thursday night, mentioned in passing

Ernest Worthing.name: Ernest Worthing
Ernest Worthing.role: Jack's alter ego in town, a fictional younger brother invented by Jack to escape to London; also the name Jack is known by in town

Gwendolen Fairfax.name: Gwendolen Fairfax
Gwendolen Fairfax.role: Lady Bracknell's daughter and Algernon's cousin, the object of Jack's affection

Cecily Cardew.name: Cecily Cardew
Cecily Cardew.role: Jack's ward, a young girl living in the country under Jack's guardianship, described as pretty and eighteen

Bunbury.name: Bunbury
Bunbury.role: A fictional invalid friend invented by Algernon to escape social obligations

Mary Farquhar.name: Mary Farquhar
Mary Farquhar.role: A woman known to Lady Bracknell, noted for flirting with her husband at dinner parties

Lady Harbury.name: Lady Harbury
Lady Harbury.role: A woman visited by Lady Bracknell, recently widowed and noted for looking younger after her husband's death

Gerald.name: Gerald
Gerald.role: Gwendolen's brother, mentioned as someone who proposes for practice

Lord Bracknell.name: Lord Bracknell
Lord Bracknell.role: Lady Bracknell's husband and Gwendolen's father, mentioned as having health issues

Duchess of Bolton.name: Duchess of Bolton
Duchess of Bolton.role: A peeress who collaborates with Lady Bracknell on a list of eligible young men

Lady Bloxham.name: Lady Bloxham
Lady Bloxham.role: An elderly lady who rents Jack's house in Belgrave Square

Thomas Cardew.name: Thomas Cardew
Thomas Cardew.role: A deceased gentleman who adopted Jack and made him guardian to Cecily

Miss Prism.name: Miss Prism
Miss Prism.role: Cecily's governess, responsible for her education, known for her strict demeanor and past as a novelist

Canon Chasuble.name: Canon Chasuble
Canon Chasuble.role: A rector who interacts with Miss Prism and Cecily, known for his metaphorical speech and religious duties
